job_description:
• Applies SPC, FDC, and 8D methodology to process optimization, testing, creating, and modifying process related procedures, and disposition of lots to increase the tool availability and turns through systematic problem solving Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Material Science, or Physics.
• However, other engineering or related fields may be considered Must be flexible to work any shift and rotate shifts as needed (allowing for flexibility around school schedule where applicable) Proficient in one or more scripting, programming and visualization tools: Python, Java, Tableau, Matlab, Microsoft Suite Completes all required safety training and conducts all work in accordance with safety policies and regulations New College Grad - RAM RDA Process Engineer ID1Boise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 17 days ago New College Grad - Process Integration EngineerBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 11 days ago Analyzes data using various application and engineering knowledge to make critical process decisions New College Grad - ATE Process Engineer ID1Boise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 2 months ago Hands-on experience in the field of data analytics, preferably with experience querying databases.
